S31640-003_syn_2: OPERATIVE SUMMARY: The patient presented with critical central airway obstruction secondary to small cell carcinoma. Rigid bronchoscopy was initiated. The carina and proximal left mainstem were occluded by neoplastic tissue. Aggressive mechanical debulking was performed utilizing the rigid bevel for coring, followed by piecemeal excision with forceps and microdebridement. This resulted in significant recanalization of the left mainstem bronchus.
S31640-003_syn_3:
Code 31640: Bronchoscopy with excision of tumor.
Target: Carina and Left Mainstem.
Instruments: Rigid Bronchoscope (coring), Forceps, Microdebrider.
Description: Mechanical removal of obstructing tumor tissue. No ablative therapies (laser/cryo) employed. Procedure focused on physical excision to restore airway patency.

S31640-003_syn_8: We performed a rigid bronchoscopy to address the patient's severe airway obstruction. The tumor at the carina and left mainstem was mechanically debulked. We used the bevel of the rigid scope to core through the mass, then removed the fragments with forceps. A microdebrider was used to clean up the edges. This physical removal of the tumor opened the airway significantly. We managed some bleeding with a balloon and epinephrine.
S31640-003_syn_9: Rigid endoscopy utilizing jet ventilation. The carinal neoplasm was excavated using the rigid barrel. Tissue fragments were plucked with forceps. A rotary cutting tool was used to shave the residual mass. The airway caliber was augmented via physical extraction of the malignancy. Hemorrhage was stemmed with tamponade.
S31640-003:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

Patient: [REDACTED], 72-year-old male
MRN: [REDACTED]
Date: [REDACTED]
Location: [REDACTED]
Attending: Dr. Priyanka Rao
Assistant: Dr. Eric Williams (Fellow)

Indication:
Recurrent hemoptysis and dyspnea due to carinal mass from small cell lung cancer with near-complete obstruction of the left mainstem bronchus.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of carinal and left mainstem tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Airway:
General anesthesia, rigid bronchoscope with jet ventilation. ASA class IV.

Findings:
Friable, circumferential tumor involving the main carina and extending into the proximal left mainstem causing approximately 85â€“90% obstruction with clot burden. Right mainstem lumen narrowed <20%.

Interventions:
Old clot was suctioned from the left mainstem. The rigid bronchoscope bevel was then used for aggressive rigid coring of the exophytic tumor at the carina and into the left mainstem. Multiple large tumor fragments were removed using forceps and suction. Subsequent passes with the microdebrider further debulked residual tissue. Overall, the tumor was mechanically debulked and excised in piecemeal fashion until the left mainstem lumen was restored to ~30% residual narrowing. No radiofrequency ablation, PDT, or cryotherapy was used.

Hemostasis:
Brisk bleeding during initial debulking controlled with topical epinephrine and brief balloon tamponade; no blood products required.

EBL:
Approximate blood loss 80 mL.

Complications:
Transient hypotension responsive to vasopressor bolus. No sustained hypoxia.

Disposition:
Remained intubated post-procedure and transferred to ICU for ventilatory support and close monitoring. Oncology notified for expedited systemic therapy planning.
